intro: Pseudocamelina kleinii, commonly known as the Klein's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Pseudocamelina kleinii is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
